snippet: The defense secretary and the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff share a reluctance to use military might overseas, in contrast to the Pentagon in the George W. Bush years.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry remains leading figure in debate over whether to undertake military intervention in Syria, more so than Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel and Joint Chiefs chairman Gen Martin E Dempsey, highlighting how Pentagon influence has taken a back seat under Pres Obama.
lead_paragraph: The defense secretary and the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff share a reluctance to use military might overseas, in contrast to the Pentagon in the George W. Bush years.

headline.print_headline: Pentagon in Back Seat As Kerry Leads Charge
headline.main: Pentagon in Back Seat as Kerry Leads Charge
